title: Renewables Are Holding Back the Emissions Tide
description:
Global emissions in 2022 are projected to rise just a fraction of the amount they increased by last year, thanks in large part to a surge in renewables installation and electric vehicle use, a major global energy organization said this week.

title: Thruster Glitch Likely Doomed Japan's Epsilon-6 Rocket Launch
description:
A Japanese rocket had to be intentionally destroyed last week during launch, marking the first failure of the company’s Epsilon-6 rocket. An initial investigation points to the rocket’s attitude control system as the source of the major malfunction.

title: Chess Champ Files $100 Million Lawsuit Against Magnus Carlsen and Chess.com Over Cheating Allegations
description: The ongoing chess cheating scandal now has some dollar signs attached to it. On Wednesday, burgeoning chess master Hans Neimann filed a $100 Million complaint against five-time World Chess Champion Magnus Carlsen over multiple hints and outright allegations of cheating.

title: Virgin Orbit Could Soon Provide ‘Responsive’ Space Launch Services for NATO
description:
The Luxembourg Directorate of Defense and Virgin Orbit signed an agreement earlier this week to explore the possibility of developing “responsive space capabilities” for use by NATO and possibly other allies.

title: Hubble Spots Twin Tails After NASA’s Asteroid Smash-Up
description:
A new image from the Hubble Space Telescope shows a pair of dusty tails extending out from Didymos-Dimorphos, the result of NASA’s DART spacecraft smashing into the smaller member of the binary asteroid system.

description:
The European Space Agency is now targeting late 2023 for the inaugural launch of its next-generation Ariane 6 rocket, in what is yet another delay for the debut of this heavy-lift launch vehicle.
